alert.note: Alert for Cook (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 5:19PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Cook and Lake Counties. * WHEN...Until 830 PM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 518 PM CDT Tuesday, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Kelso River, Kawishiwi River, Vern River, Ferne Creek, Temperance River, Plouff Creek, Ahmoo Creek, Maniwaki Creek, Pipe Creek, Horn Creek and Drumstick Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, Kawishiwi Lake, Phoebe Lake, Alice Lake, Sawbill Lake, Hudson Lake, Cherokee Lake and Brule Lake. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
